Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Animal Chalice, Grand or Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky brown; white dot preserved, above a wide white band; exterior: undetermined painted decoration.
Curator's comments: The size of the sherd makes it difficult to determine to which style the sherd belongs. The presence of interior decoration points to a date starting no earlier than 610BC with the beginning of the Mature Animal Style. The lack of incision suggests that the sherd does not date later than circa 560BC with the end of the Chalice Style.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0676) (phase 2)
